features: Multi-use cement for gaskets and small stove repairs
Adheres fiberglass stove gaskets to metal
Can also repair small metal cracks or bond metal to metal
body.description: The Original black silicate-ceramic stove cement. Adheres all types of gasket materials to airtight stoves and is used for making metal to metal or metal to masonry repairs.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: RUTLAND Stove & Gasket Cement - 2.3 oz. Tube RUTLAND Stove & Gasket Cement pulls double duty because not only can this cement adhere any fiberglass gasket to most any metal, it can also be used to fix those small cracks, pinholes, and leaks in a cast iron stove. Available in a handy squeeze tube or in a larger caulk gun-ready size, this cement will help restore a stove to safe and efficient operation. Before it is heat cured, it can also be cleaned up with water, so there’s no need to worry about small mistakes when applying, even if it has already dried. Rated to 2000°F (1090°C) Indoor use only Paintable after heat curing Made in the USA RUTLAND Stove & Gasket Cement - 10.3 oz. Cartridge RUTLAND Stove & Gasket Cement pulls double duty because not only can this cement adhere any fiberglass gasket to most any metal, it can also be used to fix those small cracks, pinholes, and leaks in a cast iron stove. Available in a handy squeeze tube or in a larger caulk gun-ready size, this cement will help restore a stove to safe and efficient operation. Before it is heat cured, it can also be cleaned up with water, so there’s no need to worry about small mistakes when applying, even if it has already dried. Rated to 2000°F (1090°C)Indoor use onlyPaintable after heat curingMade in the USA RUTLAND E-Z Spread Fiberglass Stove Gasket Cement - 2.3 oz. Tube RUTLAND E-Z Spread Fiberglass Stove Gasket Cement is designed specifically to be the easiest gasket cement for affixing fiberglass gaskets to steel and cast iron. Very easy to spread and control application and will not expand or contract during continued use. Rated to 2000°F (1090°C)Can be painted after heat cureIndoor use onlyMade in the USA RUTLAND E-Z Spread Fiberglass Stove Gasket Cement - 10.3 oz. Cartridge RUTLAND E-Z Spread Fiberglass Stove Gasket Cement is designed specifically to be the easiest gasket cement for affixing fiberglass gaskets to steel and cast iron. Very easy to spread and control application and will not expand or contract during continued use. Rated to 2000°F (1090°C)Can be painted after heat cureIndoor use onlyMade in the USA RUTLAND Stove & Gasket Cement - #77 RUTLAND Stove & Gasket Cement - #78 RUTLAND E-Z Spread Fiberglass Stove & Gasket Cement - #77E RUTLAND E-Z Spread Fiberglass Stove & Gasket Cement - #78E

RUTLAND Products Fit Your Lifestyle! RUTLAND has been manufacturing stove and fireplace maintenance products since 1883. Over the last 130+ years, RUTLAND has grown from a small, family-owned business in Rutland, Vermont to a well-known manufacturer within the industry. Whether your lifestyle is fast, furious, and stressful or laid back and care-free, RUTLAND offers you the opportunity to enjoy life just a bit more with our line of quality fireplace, chimney, and hearth lifestyle products, maintenance products, and accessories. Serving the needs of homeowners and professionals alike, our product line includes fire starters, creosote, and soot removers, high temperature silicone sealants, cements and mortars, stove door replacement gaskets, chimney cleaning rods and brushes, and more!

RUTLAND Products Make Life Fun Enhance the ambiance of your next wood fire by adding beautiful blue and green flames with RUTLAND Rainbow Flame Crystals! Simply shake about 1/2 cup of crystals onto a hot bed of coals or toss one of our convenient Rainbow Flame Sticks into the fire and watch the flames change colors. Use indoors or outdoors. Fun for the whole family! RUTLAND Products Make Life Safe RUTLAND Safe Lite Fire Starter Squares are easy to light, even when wet! These fire starters are nontoxic and made of recycled wood materials and wax. No more dangerous flare-ups! Only 1 – 2 squares are needed to start a fire. These economical fire starters are great for indoor or outdoor fireplaces, wood stoves, and fire pits! RUTLAND Products Make Life Easy RUTLAND Stove, Grill & Hearth Conditioning Glass Cleaner is a versatile cleaner that easily removes baked-on soot, creosote, carbon, and other mineral residues from glass doors of fireplace inserts and stoves. It also has countless uses around the house, including ceramic cook tops, stainless steel, chrome, porcelain, tile, fiberglass shower doors, and more! Leaves behind a thin, protective silicone layer to make the next cleaning even easier!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Like a charm
reviews.reviewText: The rope seal on my wood stove was falling off, so I decided to try this stuff. I kneeded the tube a bit, as per directions, then I put a generous bead around the stove door and pushed the seal back into place. I closed the door & let it sit for the rest of the day. The next day, I fired up the stove & checked to see if it was over the temp required to cure this stuff. (Over 550°) No fuss, no muss. No cleanup due to being careful with the application. This stuff worked like a charm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and works well!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Messy, tube dries even if unopened, effective repairs
reviews.reviewText: We use this to fix leaks on our wood stove as recommended by the shop we bought our stove from many years ago. We cleanup best we can, then squirt this stuff into the seam to fill in the gaps. Then let it cure per directions on the package. The liquid texture is great for small gaps down low, but a huge pain for top outside gaps where it drips all over the place.I just pulled out a tube I bought over 5 years ago and it dried into a paste. I ended up having to slit open the tube to scoop it out, and use my fingers to spread it into the gap.I wish they sold this in a spreadable paste since this semi dried up version was far easier to work with. I hope this old stuff sets and holds!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and apply and causes liner to stick and stay in place. Would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Mostly dried up
reviews.reviewText: Almost impossible to get out of the tube. It was dried up in spots. You couldn't just use this like caulk so it was very messy trying to use it.It was also very sticky.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as described!
reviews.reviewText: Just what I was looking for. Great price and fast shipping!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It was hard to come out, then it gushed out probably because we didn't knead the contents well before using.
Needed to fix the wood stove door. This stuff works well.

TUVE QUE PISARLO PARA QUE SALIERA EL PEGAMENTO, CUANDO SALIO, EL PRODUCTO VENIA UNA PARTE DURA QUE ES LA OBSTRUIA LA SALIDA CONTINUA DEL PEGAMENTO, POSTERIORMENTE SALIO MUY LIQUIDO EL PEGAMENTO COMO SI FUERA AGUA. YO ME IMAGINABA QUE SALDRIA ESPESO COMO TIPO PASTA, DE IGUAL FORMA UTILICE EL PEGAMENTO Y FUNCIONO, AL OTRO DIA, VERIFIQUE SI SE HABIA ADHERIDO EL PEGAMENTO AL VIDRIO Y SI, REALMENTE FUNCIONA. AHORA TENGO QUE ESPERAR COMO FUNCIONA AL UTILIZAR EL HORNO, ESPERO, NO SE DESPEGUE.
